vulnerability_location.description: Hard-coded backdoor in withdraw(): allows a specific address to become Owner and bypass proper ownership checks
Low-level call using adr.call.value(msg.value)(data) without checking its return value
Use of transfer to external addresses (Owner.transfer and msg.sender.transfer) can fail if recipient fallback reverts, causing the functions to revert and blocking contract functionality
Function Command takes an address parameter without validating msg.data length, allowing a short address attack

Floating pragma version (^0.4.19) allows compilation with unintended future compiler versions; unsafe low-level call with adr.call.value(msg.value)(data) without checking return value can lead to unhandled failures or reentrancy
